name: Arduinoladder
tagline: GUI application to create Arduino programs using ladder logic (like a PLC)
body:
![logic.png](http://beeond.net/landing/images/LadderLogic.png)

### Arduino as a PLC.
ArduinoLadder is an open source project that allows users to develop Arduino sketches using a graphical ladder logic editor.
The software is developed using Mono, the multi-platform version of .NET. Therefore, it can be comiled to run on Windows, Linux, or MacOS.
Initially a Windows installer will be provided for those users that do not want to deal with compilers and coding.


### How it works
ArduinoLadder has been created as a GUI code generator that uses [Electronics&Micros' plcLib](http://www.electronics-micros.com/software-hardware/plclib-arduino/) libraries. The libraries implment high level functions to instantiate coils, contact, latches, timers, etc. connected by rungs as you would in a [ladder logic diagram](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ladder_logic).

### Usage
We are working on a detailed documentation and a video tutorial as we iprove the user experience. For now, to understand what you can do, you may refer to the plcLib documentation on [getting started with ladder logic](http://www.electronics-micros.com/software-hardware/plclib-arduino-ladder-logic/).
Also, you will find some raw documentation in the Documents folder of the project.
